title: Genk 1-4 Liverpool: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain wonder goal steals the show in flashy win
text:
Alex Oxlade Chamberlain scored two great goals in Genk (Picture: Getty Images)

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain stole the show as Liverpool picked up an ultimately comfortable 4-1 victory away to Genk in the Champions League.

The 26-year-old scored twice, both worthy of note, but the second was a thing of beauty as he bent an effort into the top corner from outside of the box.

This came in the 57th minute after he had opened the scoring after just two minutes to set his side on course for the impressive victory away from home.

Sadio Mane and Mohamed Salah got in on the act in the last 15 minutes, both with classy finishes as the European champions stepped on the accelerator pedal.

However, a game Genk side were not to be deterred and kept pressing till the death, getting their reward with two minutes to go of the 90 through a clever strike from substitute Stephen Odey.

Advertisement

Advertisement

It was the least the Belgians deserved after a gutsy performance for much of the match and causing the Premier League side problems in the first half.

It took less than two minutes for Liverpool to lead in Belgium! What a moment for Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain on his first Champions League game for 18 months 🙌 Great hit! pic.twitter.com/EIWf4ydv9c — Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) October 23, 2019

Oxlade-Chamberlain’s first was typical of the classy midfielder, calmly rolling the ball into the bottom corner from outside of the box with pinpoint accuracy, not needing to put much pace on the ball.

That goal after two minutes made it look like Liverpool would romp to a huge score, but the first half was actually extremely even, with the home side happy to attack, and enjoy success by getting behind the buccaneering Liverpool fullbacks.

Genk had an equaliser disallowed before the break, with the most marginal of offside decisions going against them and giving the Reds a chance.

Things were a bit nervy for the Champions League holders, but they asserted their superiority after the break and the Ox produced a moment of brilliance.

The ball was rolled to him by Roberto Firmino and from the ‘D’ he flicked the ball first time with the outside of his right boot, off the inside of the crossbar and over the line.

Absolute class from The Ox!! 😱 First time ✔️

Outside of the boot ✔️

In off the crossbar ✔️ He's got his second of the night and it is truly sublime! pic.twitter.com/nqV2xBGnno — Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) October 23, 2019

Advertisement

Advertisement

Jurgen Klopp’s side were free-flowing at this point and a lovely team goal was finished off by Sadio Mane who dinked over the goalkeeper after a through ball from Salah.

The Egyptian then got on the score sheet himself with some very clever and quick feet in the penalty area before finding the corner of the goal.

The footwork from Salah! 😍 The Egyptian gives the Genk defence the slip as Liverpool run riot in Belgium. pic.twitter.com/YPhl0N17Z4 — Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) October 23, 2019

Genk got what they deserved, though, and that was a consolation as Dieumerci N’Dongala forced an error from Dejan Lovren on the touchline before bursting into the box and pulling back for Odey who swept past Alisson.

The only concern for Klopp was that Andrew Robertson went off in the second half with a knock, although it did not appear serious.
